page.title: 17LIVING WITH TREES
page.content: 1985 The valley folk have lost their forebodings.They have "learned to look with kindlier eye upon the forest legions which cushionthe rounded contours of the rolling hills".No longer do they see the forests as invading hosts which march relentlessly , ousting the soft-eyed sheep , the gentle lamb.Rather they are "beneficial cover to a thousand living things, the deer ,the world of wildlife". The trees have been accepted. Meantime, the foresters load their timber lorries ;wildlife officers cull the deer .Shepherds dig flocks from snowdrifts, meteorologists observe the weather changes, seismologists keep their "ear to the ground"for earthquakes and explosions. Down in the valley life goes on and prayer flags flutter at the Tibetan Centre.
